page.title: 05GT.YARNMOUTH STADIUM
page.content: THE GREAT YARMOUTH STADIUM We went to visit Mr. Franklyn, who has been interested in racing greyhounds since 1928. The stadium was finally completed by May 1940. The original stadium was where the Heliport is now. The heliport is next door to the New Stadium. Speedway began in 1947, but they couldn't take enough profit to continue. The greyhound track was once grass but is now sand. Sand is better because there are less accidents. During firework displays greyhounds are taken to the barn to stop them becoming frightened. When Mr. Franklyn used to run greyhounds at the stadium, he made many trips to Ireland because he found they were best there.
